intro: Piptocarpha oblonga var. lepidota, commonly known as the silverleaf hitchcockia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its silvery, woolly foliage that gives it its common name. The plant produces small, yellow disk flowers that are typically clustered in dense, spherical heads. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in desert ecosystems.
